1.brief: properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

2.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

3.brief: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to be (or become) pregnant, conceive (literally or figuratively)
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply

4.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, the upper part, used only adverbially with prefix upward, above, overhead, from the top, etc.
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
obscuration (as if from shrinkage of light, i.e. an eclipse (only in plural)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

6.brief: properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a year (as a revolution of time)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

7.brief: properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
sterile (as wrapped up too hard); figuratively, desolate
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

8.brief: to puncture, literally (to perforate, with more or less violence) or figuratively (to specify, designate, libel)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
prepared; by implication, skilful; feminine plural the future; also treasure
a wreathed animal, i.e. a serpent (especially the crocodile or some other large sea-monster); figuratively, the constellation of the dragon; also as a symbol of Babylon

9.brief: to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails)
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eyelash (as fluttering); figuratively, morning ray

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

11.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire

12.brief: to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
the breast of a woman or animal (as bulging)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to suck; causatively, to give milk

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)

14.brief: adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, drought, i.e. (by implication) a desolation

15.brief: desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a head person (of any rank or class)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money

16.brief: desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

17.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle
commotion, restlessness (of a horse), crash (of thunder), disquiet, anger
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

18.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to drive (an animal, a workman, a debtor, an army); by implication, to tax, harass, tyrannize

19.brief: abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

20.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
toiling; concretely, a laborer; figuratively, sorrowful
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

21.brief: properly, to adhere to; hence, to await
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
a secret storehouse; hence, a secreted valuable (buried); generally money

22.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
near, with or among; often in general, to
a revolution (of time, i.e. an age); also joy
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

23.brief: properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.

24.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to flow forth (literally or figuratively); by implication, to liquify
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

25.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

to be tranquil, i.e. secure or successful
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)

commotion, restlessness (of a horse), crash (of thunder), disquiet, anger
